poem:
### Sequel of Longing

Bright screens flicker  
art nouveau dreams—  
in the living room glow,  
whispers of worlds  
turn our eyes wide,  

children stitch mysteries,  
family bound by pixels,  
little voices  
against steel giants—  
a moment's escape,  

the sequel arrives,  
yet we seek the first breath  
of wonder  
once more.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "My family’s excitement about Outer Worlds 2 was short-lived | Dominik Diamond It was an exciting November for the Diamond household: one of those rare games that we all loved had a sequel coming out! The original Outer Worlds dazzled our eyeballs with its art nouveau palette and charmed our ears with witty dialogue, sucking us into a classic mystery-unravelling story in one of my favourite “little man versus evil corporate overlords” worlds since Deus". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: My family’s excitement about Outer Worlds 2 was short-lived | Dominik Diamond It was an exciting November for the Diamond household: one of those rare games that we all loved had a sequel coming out! The original Outer Worlds dazzled our eyeballs with its art nouveau palette and charmed our ears with witty dialogue, sucking us into a classic mystery-unravelling story in one of my favourite “little man versus evil corporate overlords” worlds since Deus
